questions and concerns that clients inquire about  What were looking for  A Hacker Mindset  Minimum of 5 years of LinuxUNIX systems engineer amp administrator experience Minimum of 2 years of relevant web application or infrastructure security experience It does not need to be a securityspecific position The most important thing is passiondesire for security Extensive AWS experience Automation experience with configuration and resource management tools such as Terraform preferred Ansible Chef Puppet or Cloudformation Proficient in bash shell scripting and one of Ruby Python or Golang title: Project Manager
description: About AgreenaAgreena is an exciting dynamic and purposeoriented organisation united in a mission to drive impact for farmers and the climate While were rooted in agriculture finance and technology our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts More than 30 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag  either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen or remotely across EuropeAgreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability Within the last year alone we have helped farmers across 13 countries in their conversion journey to regenerative farming practices Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility and we encourage new thinking innovation and funAnd this is where you come inAs a Technical Project Manager you will support and empower the Agreena Program team to deliver key projects related to carbon standards scientific methodologies and overall program operations This person will have a general knowledge of climate and the environment related to agriculture combined with experience in communication and collaborating with teams to achieve key project deadlines An ideal candidate facilitates team engagement in projects through strong organisation and processdriven abilities to enable project successThe Agreena Program team investigates the science required for on farm activity and data measurement that can support verification by independent standards which demonstrate carbon removals and reductions on farm The team comprises the Science Standards and Program amp Data Operations groups You will be a part of the Program team and provide project management support across multiple projectsHow will you make an impact Coordinate and drive timelines with third parties engaging with the Agreena program to ensure accountability and timelines are observed Willing to adapt in a project environment with unknown factors and many dependencies that need to be considered throughout a project lifecycle Establish project management practices for core projects including set up plan monitor control and close projects Crossfunctional collaboration working with resources across multiple disciplines of science data and standards Ensure clear communication across other ongoing projects within the team Build networks and stakeholder maps for projects across the wider business Build strong links with your colleagues working on the scientific methodologies modelling statistical analysis and data collection Support team members in executing projects throughout the project life cycle and according to project management guidelines  Fluency in EnglishBonus points if you Have scientific knowledge of research and relevant literature in carbon and soil science with focus in the agricultural and agroforestry sectors Have excellent analytical and problem solving skills  Are passionate about collaborating with different teams and disciplinesWhats in it for you A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fastgrowing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues Competitive compensation package and holidays  Remote work policyTeam events throughout the year  An exciting purposeled culture and mission  Open communication and supportive feedback culture Work Location Copenhagen

risk management supplier quality change control and Quality Management Systems  Work Location  Austin TX
